name: Black Belt
description:
An Osage original, these handcrafted belts are made of harness leather tanned from American steers.  The screw posts—or “Chicago screws”—allow for interchanging any Osage buckle.

Note:  Specify sizing in "note to seller" upon your order (after supplying payment info).  The most accurate way to size is to measure a current belt from the hardware end to the most used hole.

Specs:
Dimensions: 1 1/2” x sized to fit
Materials: Black harness leather and Chicago screws

name: Brown Belt
description:
An Osage original, these handcrafted belts are made of harness leather tanned from American steers.  The screw posts—or “Chicago screws”—allow for interchanging any Osage buckle.

Note:  Specify sizing in "note to seller" upon your order (after supplying payment info).  The most accurate way to size is to measure a current belt from the hardware end to the most used hole.

Specs:
Dimensions: 1 1/2” x sized to fit
Materials: Brown harness leather and Chicago screws

name: Birch Borealis Series 2
description:
Before rot set into this Black Birch tree, fungi took to work making an abstract display within the wood. The subtle Walnut stripe breaks across the horizon of black streaks and carries itself on over to the solid Walnut backing.

Specs:

Dimensions: 2-3/4” x 1-3/4”
Belt Size: 1 ½” width
Hook to Loop Length: 2-1/4”
Materials: Spalted River Birch (Betula nigra) and Black Walnut (Juglans nigra) with a Walnut backing
Finish: Polyurethane

name: Bengal Tiger (Billowed) Series
description:
No telling how long this old Osage log was sitting in the woods.  Splits through the surface allowed the surrounding wood to weather, thus creating the “tiger stripes” in the still sound yellow wood.  The age also produced a unique sheen not seen in fresher wood.  You don’t have to be a Cincinnatian (or a football fan) to appreciate this one.  

Specs:

Dimensions: 2-1/2 x 2-1/8”
Belt Size: 1 ½” width
Hook to Loop Length: 2”
Materials: Osage Orange (Maclura pomifera) with a Walnut (Juglans nigra) backing
Finish: Polyurethane

name: Bengal Tiger (Rectangle) Series
description:
No telling how long this old Osage log was sitting in the woods.  Splits through the surface allowed the surrounding wood to weather, thus creating the “tiger stripes” in the still sound yellow wood.  The age also produced a unique sheen not seen in fresher wood.  You don’t have to be a Cincinnatian (or a football fan) to appreciate this one.
  
Specs:

Dimensions: 2-3/4 x 1-3/4”
Belt Size: 1 ½” width
Hook to Loop Length: 2-1/4”
Materials: Osage Orange (Maclura pomifera) with a Walnut (Juglans nigra) backing
Finish: Polyurethane

name: Bengal Tiger (Rounded) Series
description:
No telling how long this old Osage log was sitting in the woods.  Splits through the surface allowed the surrounding wood to weather, thus creating the “tiger stripes” in the still sound yellow wood.  The age also produced a unique sheen not seen in fresher wood.  You don’t have to be a Cincinnatian (or a football fan) to appreciate this one.  

Specs:

Dimensions: 2-3/4 x 1-3/4”
Belt Size: 1 ½” width
Hook to Loop Length: 2”
Materials: Osage Orange (Maclura pomifera) with a Walnut (Juglans nigra) backing
Finish: Polyurethane

name: Birch Mirage Series
description:
The “spalted” birch is a natural phenomenon in the wood—as a mirage is a natural phenomenon in the sky.  Both the birch and the mirage have an abstract aesthetic that inspires admiration in the workings of Mother Nature.  This buckle does nothing more than capture the work that has already been done.

Specs:

Dimensions: 3” x 1-7/8”
Belt Size: 1 ½” width
Hook to Loop Length: 2-1/4”
Materials: Spalted River Birch (Betula nigra) with a Black Cherry (Prunus serotina) backing
Finish: Polyurethane

name: Diamond Jack Series
description:
A mirrored pattern of Cherry and Walnut woods, the Diamond Jack has style and class.

Specs:

Dimensions: 2-3/4” x 1-3/4”
Belt Size: 1 ½” width
Hook to Loop Length: 2-1/4”
Materials: Black Walnut (Juglans nigra) wood and Black Cherry (Prunus serotina) wood
Finish: Polyurethane

name: Weathered Barnwood Series
description:
As the name suggests, this buckle was made from decades old Oak barn wood.  The rough sawn surface had weathered to a characteristic grey, which is preserved on the front side of the buckle.  But what really makes this buckle unique is the nail hole.  The stubborn old nail, during its many years of service, had stained the board as the metal oxidized.  This staining can be seen as it spread, mostly along the wood grain, on the back of the buckle.  This unique buckle is preserving and celebrating a small piece of American history.

Specs:

Dimensions: 3-1/4” x 2”
Belt Size: 1 ½” width
Hook to Loop Length: 2 ½”
Materials: Red Oak (Quercus sp.) barn wood
Finish: Rubbed Oil

name: Tiger Stripe Series
description:
The “quarter sawn” White Oak wood was cut to reveal the beautiful ray patterning characteristic of classic oak furniture.  The Walnut is set back slightly from the Oak, adding interest in the form of a subtle shadow-line.  This buckle especially is proof of the quality of wood that the trees of North America can produce—no need for exotics here!

Specs:

Dimensions: 3” x 1-7/8”
Belt Size: 1 ½” width
Hook to Loop Length: 2 ½”
Materials: White Oak (Quercus alba) wood and Black Walnut (Juglans nigra) wood
Finish: Polyurethane

name: Osage Wave Classic Series
description:
The “wave” comes from the unique grain patterning of the Osage log from which these buckles were made.  It is a “classic” because this buckle is nearly identical to one of the first wood buckles I ever made—the one I still wear nearly every day!  Wood darkens to a rich golden brown with age.

Specs:

Dimensions: 3 ½” x 2 ¼”
Belt Size: 1 ½” width
Hook to Loop Length: 2 ½”
Materials: Osage Orange (Maclura pomifera) end-grain wood, with Osage Orange edge-grain wood backing
Finish: Rubbed Mink Oil

name: Denim Six Series
description:
Yep, real denim.  Six layers of old blue jean was soaked in epoxy, then pressed over a wire grate to form the six diamond shaped figures.  Once it hardens, it becomes extremely durable, and once sanded through the different layers create the cool pattern.  With an Osage wood backing.

Specs:

Dimensions: 3” x 2 ¼”
Belt Size: 1 ½”
Hook to Loop Length: 2 1/8”
Materials: Denim (Blue Jean) and Osage Orange (Maclura pomifera) wood backing
Finish: Rubbed Mink Oil

name: SMS Series
description:
Both the premiere American hard woods are together in this buckle.  Walnut on either side of a piece of straight grained Cherry.

Specs:

Dimensions: 3” x 1 ¾”
Belt Size: 1 ½”
Hook to Loop Length: 2 1/8”
Materials: Black Walnut (Juglans nigra) wood and Black Cherry (Prunus serotina) wood
Finish: Polyurethane

name: Reh Bull Series
description:
This one’s dedicated to my grandfather.  The end-grain Locust wood was cut from an old fence post he split when he was a young man.  The bull figure is made from real Black Angus bull hair mixed in hardened epoxy.  This buckle is a tribute to the American cattle farmer, and one of the best there was.

Specs:

Dimensions: 3 1/8” x 2 ¼”
Belt Size: 1 ½”
Hook to Loop Length: 2 1/8”
Materials: Black Locust (Robinia psuedoacacia) end-grain wood, with Black Locust edge-grain wood backing, and Black Angus Bull hair in hardened epoxy
Finish: Polyurethane

name: Bass Lake Series
description:
This largemouth bass—made from real bass scales mixed in hardened epoxy—is jumping at bass lake just as the sun’s going down.  Catch him.

Specs:

Dimensions: 2 ¾” x 1 ¾”
Belt Size: 1 ½”
Hook to Loop Length: 2 1/8”
Materials: Black Walnut (Juglans nigra) wood, Osage Orange (Maclura pomifera) wood, with Black Cherry (Prunus serotina)  wood backing and real bass scales mixed in hardened epoxy
Finish: Polyurethane

name: Osage Sunrise Series
description:
The Osage log was cut to take advantage of the arched growth rings.  The light Hickory backing blends with golden Osage and adds strength.  Darkens to a rich golden brown with age.

Specs:

Dimensions: 2 ½” x 2”
Belt Size: 1 ½”
Hook to Loop Length: 2”
Materials: Osage Orange (Maclura pomifera) end-grain wood, with Shagbark Hickory (Carya ovata) wood backing
Finish: Rubbed Oil

name: Osage Sunset Series (Rectangle)
description:
The arched growth rings of the golden Osage contrast beautifully with the deep brown of the Walnut backing.  Darkens to a rich golden brown with age.

Specs:

Dimensions: 2 ½” x 1 7/8”
Belt Size: 1 ½”
Hook to Loop Length: 2”
Materials: Osage Orange (Maclura pomifera) end-grain wood, with Black Walnut (Juglans nigra) wood backing
Finish: Rubbed Mink Oil

name: Osage Sunset Series (Rounded)
description:
The arched growth rings of the golden Osage contrast beautifully with the deep brown of the Walnut backing.  Darkens to a rich golden brown with age.

Specs:

Dimensions: 2 ¾” x 1 7/8”
Belt Size: 1 ½”
Hook to Loop Length: 2”
Materials: Osage Orange (Maclura pomifera) end-grain wood, with Black Walnut (Juglans nigra) wood backing
Finish: Rubbed Mink Oil

name: FarmHouse Custom
description: A custom FarmHouse buckle.  Belt is included.

name: Golden Design Custom
description: Custom buckle recreating the "golden mean" with maple, cherry, and osage orange woods.

name: Osage Streamline Series
description:
This buckle is designed to be truly streamlined.  The two sides are gently sloped, making a natural transition into the belt, while the top and bottom edges are left to continue the line created by the belt edges.  The single stripe of walnut, running through the Osage endgrain, further ties the buckle to a similar brown colored belt.

Specs:

Dimensions: 2-3/4” x 1-5/8”
Belt Size: 1 ½” width
Hook to Loop Length: 2 ¼”
Materials: Osage Orange (Maclura pomifera) end-grain wood and Black Walnut (Juglans nigra) wood
Finish: Rubbed Oil
